metadata.title: Thursday, 9th July, 2015
metadata.session: FOURTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a)    whether the Government is aware that at least three pupils at Kabompo Secondary School have died;
(b)    if so, what the cause of the deaths is; and
(c)    when the School, which was closed after the death of the pupils, will be re-opened.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)    what the total housing stock for the Lusaka City Council was, before the Government decided to sell the houses in 1996;
(b)    what the current housing stock for the Council is;
(c)    of the houses at (b), how many are currently on rent; and
(d)    what action was taken on sitting tenants who failed to purchase the houses.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)    how successful the ‘Keep Zambia Clean Campaign’ has been from inception to-date;
(b)    why refuse collection appears to be a big challenge country-wide; and
(c)    what plans the Government has to keep Zambia clean at all times.
(a)    whether the Government has any plans to establish a school of nursing in Mbala District; and
(b)    if so, when the plans will be implemented.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)    when the tarrying of township roads in Nakonde will commence;
(b)    who the contractor for the project is;
(c)    what the cost of the project is; and
(d)    what the time-frame for the completion of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health
parts: (a)    how much money was disbursed to the Orphans and Vulnerable Children in Luwingu District in 2013 and 2014;
(b)    on what activities the money was spent; and

(c)    which schools in Lubansenshi Parliamentary Constituency benefited from the funding. NOTICE OF MOTION Mr I K Banda Report of the Committee on Delegated Legislation :  That this House do adopt the Report of the Committee on Delegated Legislation, for the Fourth Session of the Eleventh National Assembly, laid on the Table of the House on 8th July, 2015. _________________
